Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dermaseptin-DA2 (DRS-DA2NEQ, Dermaseptin DA2, DRS-DA2, DRP-PD-2-2, Drs DA2; UCLL1; natural AMPs, frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: This peptide was finally isolated from frog and reproted in 2024.Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 8739 or K12 or ML35p or resistant p7 (MIC 1.6-12.5 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 or ATCC 27853 (MIC 6.3-50 uM), K. pneumoniae CIP 52.211 (MIC 0.8 uM), K. oxytoca CIP 7932 (MIC 12.5 uM),  S. enterica CIP 8297 (MIC 50 uM), Y. ruckeri ATGG 29473 (MIC 25 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 6538 or ST 1065 or MRSA (MIC 12.5-25 uM) also MIC >100 uM AMP-resistant? S. epidermidis BM 3302 (MIC 12.5 uM), L. monocytogenes SOR 100 (MIC 100 uM), E. faecalis CIP A186 (MIC 100 uM), L. garvieae ATCC 43921 (MIC 100 uM), E. faecalis CIP 103015 (MIC 12.5 uM), and K. rhizophila ATCC 9341 (MIC 0.8 uM).Structure:  it is helical in POPE:POPG (75:25) LUVs.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: induced membrane permeabilization.  (Lacombe et al., 2024).Updated Jan2024.
Literature Information.Author: Wechselberger C.1998
Literature Information.Title: Cloning of cDNAs encoding new peptides of the dermaseptin-family.
